# An outcome on its own {-}

How can we get a handle on an outcome that seems random? Although the score of a Canucks game, a stock price, or the flow of a river is uncertain, this does not mean that it's futile to predict or describe. This part of the book describes how, using only observations on a single outcome -- a study that's commonly called univariate analysis.
